result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment that is approved by her agent.  Not to terminate her employment without her agent's prior approval.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with the victim's family.  Also, no contact with Michael Gates or his residence.  Obey all no contact orders of her agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Attorney Schertz request to be removed as attorney of record.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Judge  present in the courtroom.  Due to COVID19 pandemic the following participants are appearing by video/phone by Zoom: JC Clerk, Attorneys  Adrienne  Blais for State of WI,  Dennis Schertz for Def and Richard Coad for Defendant. Defendant appearing from Taycheedah Correctional although she can not unmute herself. Postconviction matter involving Atty Schertz's motion to withdraw and Court of Appeals rejection of the no merit report, dismissing the appeal. Schertz filed no merit report. Ms Harvey has hired Atty Coad. Court of Appeals has granted the no merit report. Court defines understanding of Attorney withdrawal. Defendant can not be unmuted/heard. Coad will be filing post conviction motion following the Court of Appeals set deadline of  6/18. Coad states he had  reviewed  the letter to defendant as to her retaining him she would be foregoing any representation from the Public Defenders office. Court states withdraw warning, telling Ms Harvey it would be difficult for her to represent herself. Schertz explains letter he sent to Ms Harvey, stated she had understood and read the letter. Court makes record of the dangers Ms Harvey faces regarding representation. Court sent Ms Harvey a chat question, Ms Harvey shook head in agreement. Attys agree on the record hearing conducted the best way possible regarding Ms Harvey's muted situation.  Court allows Attorney Schertz to withdraw. Schertz will file proposed order.
Summary disposition order
No-merit report is rejected and that this appeal is dismissed without prejudice pursuant to the notice of voluntary dismissal.
for April 22, 2021 Motion Hearing

A.B.
K.B.
F.B.

Defendant appears in person, in custody,  with counsel Mathew Krische.  Special Prosecutor, Asst. Attorney General, Amber Hahn appears for the State.  Parties have received the PSI.  No corrections noted.  F.B. father of the victim made a statement to the court.  C.B., mother of the victim made a statement to the court.  A.B., victim's sister made a statement to the court.  B.C., victim's grandmother made a statement to the court.  State recommended:  Count 1 -22 years total bifurcated as 12 years initial confinement and 10 years of extended supervision.  On Count 2- 7 years total bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement, and 4 years of extended supervision.  Concurrent.  Restitution.  Pay witness fees of $1417.70  for the medical examiner and 1 expert witness.  100 days credit.  Defense recommended:  Imposed and stayed sentence, 15 years probation Count 1,  7 Years probation Count 2.  1 year conditional jail.  Or in the alternative, lower prison sentence recommended by the State and the PSI.  3-5 years initial confinement on count 1 followed by 10 years of extended supervision.  Count 2, 3-5 years initial confinement on count 1 followed by 5 years of extended supervision..  102 days credit.  Restitution agreed to by the defense.   Defendant exercised her right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  Count 1 - 20 years total bifurcated as 12 years initial confinement and 8 years of extended supervision.  On Count 2-  6 years total bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement, and  3 years of extended supervision.  Concurrent.  Restitution, $4611.95, plus surcharges.  102 days credit.  Not eligible for CIP or SAR.  No contact with victim's family.  No contact with M.G. or his residence.  No drugs or para.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obey all no contact orders of her agent.  Obtain and maintain employment approved by her agent.  Not to terminate without her agent's consent.  CC.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Defendant appears in person with counsel Mathew Krische.  Special Prosecutor, Asst. Attorney General, Amber Hahn appears for the State.  Jury is not present at this time.  Judge addressed the recorded phone calls the State wants to play as evidence.  Counsel both reiterate their arguments from yesterday.  The State also has one more clips she would like to use and there is discussion regarding that as well.  Ms. Hahn plays the 3rd clip for the Court.  Clip 2 will not be allowed to be played.  

State re-calls witness, A.M., he is still under oath, testifies.  Exhibit 28 - Defendant's Miranda Rights Form and Exhibit 29 - Defendant's written statement.  Both exhibits presented to witness which he testifies to the exhibits.  State moves admission of Exhibit 28/received.  Defense cross-examines witness.  Re-direct by the State.  State moves for admittance of Exhibit 29/received.  Witness excused.  Jury is out.  State calls M.V.S., sworn, questioned to establish a foundation for her testimony.  Defense counsel cross-examines the witness.  No re-direct by the State.  Witness steps down.  Court will allow only Clip 1 to be played.  

Jury is present.  Witness, M.V.S., previously sworn, re-takes the stand, testifies.  State plays Clip 1 which witness testifies to that content.  Exhibit 32 - Transcript of Recorded Call Clip 1.  Exhibit 31 - CD of Recorded Phone Call Clip 1.  Exhibits 31 & 32 offered/received into evidence.  Defense cross-examines witness.  Defense presents a partial copy of witness's report to refresh her memory for testimony.  Re-direct by the State.  Follow-up by defense.  Witness steps down.  State rests.  Jury is out.  Defense will confer with his client to determine if she will testify.  Short break.

Back on record with jury still out.  Attorney Krische states his client will remain silent.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding her right to testify or not testify.  She states she chooses not to testify.  Colloquy completed.  Defense will rest.  Jury back in.  Court notifies the evidentiary portion of trial is now concluded and the jury instructions will be reviewed.  Jurors excused at this time and to return by noon.  Jury instruction conference held with changes noted.  

On record outside of jury at 12:00 p.m.  Jury instruction changes and verdict changes have now been completed.  Jurors are back in and Judge begins final jury instructions.  Closing statements begin at 12:24 p.m. at 1:05 the State objects to a statement made by Attorney Krische as improper argument.  Jury out and arguments by counsel.  State's objection is overruled.  Jury back in and Attorney Krische's closing argument continues.  State gives rebuttal argument.  Closing arguments end at 1:55 p.m.  Judge completes final instructions.  Alternates (2) are excused, bailiffs sworn, and jury is out to deliberate at 2:03.  

Jury has question at 2:34.  On the record with all parties present and jury is out.  Jury is requesting to see Exhibit - Defendant's Written Statement.  State has no objection.  Defense objects.  Court will allow them to see the statement.  Exhibit 29 is sent back to the jury.

Jury has verdict at 4:16.  Jury back in the courtroom at 4:20 with all parties present.  Court reads verdicts - guilty of Count 1; guilty of Count 2.  All 12 jurors raise a hand to affirm those verdicts are correct.  Defense requests the jurors be polled.  All 12 jurors answer yes.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Court enters judgment.  State requests defendant's bond be revoked and taken into custody.  Defense objects and makes his argument.  Court reads potential penalties of counts.  Court orders defendant's bond revoked and she is remanded into custody.  PSI ordered.  Defense requests a higher cash bond if possible.  Court states that bond can be addressed at a later date.  

Off record - Special Prosecutor, Amber Hahn asked permission to admit as part of the record, a CD with a copy of her Power Point presentation for her closing.  Permission granted.  Alos, Judge said to make PSI due in 45 days.

Same appearances as motion hearing held prior.  Jury is not present.  State calls witness, V.T., sworn, testifies.  Exhibit 12 - Dr.V.T.'s curriculum vitae, witness reviews exhibit.  State moves Exhibit 12 into evidence and is received.  Exhibit 13 - Autopsy Report, given to witness to refer to for his testimony.  State moves Exhibit 13 into evidence and is received.  Defense cross-examines the witness.  Re-direct by the State.  Follow-up by the defense.  Witness is released from subpoena.  State calls T.C., sworn, testifies.  Exhibit 14 - Diagram of Murphy's Pub, witnesses uses to testify.  State moves Exhibit 14 into evidence and permission to publish to jury/received and so ordered.  Witness ID's defendant.  Refers witness to Exhibit 2 - diagram of apartment and testifies to exhibit.  Defense cross examines the witness.  Re-direct by the State.  Follow-up by defense.  Witness is released from subpoena.  Will break for lunch and to resume at 12:30.  Admonishes jurors not to discuss this case.

Reconvene at 12:26 without jury present.  Jury in at 12:30.  State calls J.L., sworn, testifies.  Witness is referred to Exhibit 14 - Murphy's Pub and testifies to the exhibit.  Defense cross-examines the witness.  No re-direct by the State.  Witness is released from subpoena.  State calls J.W., sworn, testifies.  Exhibit 18 - J.W.'s Curriculum Vitae, witness testifies to exhibit.  State moves Exhibit 18 into evidence/received.  State presents the witness Exhibits 10 - Transmittal Form and Exhibit 19, Items B-F - Receipt from State Crime Lab.  State moves Exhibit 19, into evidence/received.  State presents to witness Exhibit 20 - J.W.'s Lab Report, testifies to that exhibit.  State presents Exhibit 4 to witness and questions regarding that exhibit.  State moves Exhibits 19 & 20 into evidence/received.  Cross-examination of the witness by the defense.  No further questions from the State.  Witness is released from subpoena.  State calls M.O., sworn, testifies.  State refers witness to Exhibit #9 - Transmittal Form, and he testifies to that exhibit.  State presents witness with Exhibit 16 - CD with 3 Phones Forensic Files, witness testifies to exhibit.  State presents Exhibit 15 - M.O.'s Curriculum Vitae, witness testifies to that exhibit.  State moves Exhibits 15 & 16 into evidence/received.  Defense cross-examines the witness.  No further exhibits and witness is released from subpoena.  State calls K.S., sworn, testifies.  State presents Exhibit 21 - K.S.'s Curriculum Vitae, which witness testifies to.  State moves Exhibit 21 into evidence/received.  State refers witness to Exhibit 22 - Receipt of Evidence for Item H, and testifies to the exhibit.   State refers witness to Exhibit 19 - Receipt for Evidence, witness testifies to that exhibit as well.  State refers witness to Exhibit 4 - Contents of victim's pockets, which he testifies to this exhibit.  State presented witness with Exhibit 23 - DNA Lab Report, which witness testifies to this exhibit.  State moves Exhibit 22 & 23 into evidence/received.  Defense cross examines the witness.  No follow-up by the State and asks permission to publish Exhibit 4 to the jury.  Witness is released from subpoena.  Take short break.  Jury out.  Defense Attorney Krische states he objects to the exhibit of the recorded jail phone call.  It won't be until tomorrow.  Special Prosecutor Amber Hahn makes statement to the Court regarding proposed witnesses.  Jury back in.  State calls T.K., sworn, testifies.  No cross-examination.  Witness is released from subpoena.  Jury out by request of Amber Hahn to address an issue regarding her next witness outside the presence of the jurors.  Jury back in and State calls witness, J.R., in custody; is sworn and testifies.  Defense cross-examines the witness.  No re-direct.  Witness is excused.   State calls R.D., who is in custody;  sworn and testifies.  Witness ID's defendant.  Special Prosecutor, Amber Hahn requests the jury be taken out to address issue with witness's testimony.  Jury is out and Amber Hahn questions the witness.  No questions by defense.  Jury back in.  Questioning by Special Prosecutor, Amber Hahn continues questioning the witness.  Defense cross-examines the witness.  No follow-up.  Witness is excused.  State calls B.B. sworn, testifies.  State presents Exhibit 25 - Copy of Bond for John Rose, witness testifies to exhibit.  State moves to admit Exhibit 25/received.  Defense questions witness.  No further questions, released from subpoena.  No further witnesses.  Jury is excused and to return 9 a.m. tomorrow.  Jury is out.  Discussion for proposed witness testimony tomorrow.  State plays 2 recordings of phone calls from correctional facilities.  Discussion regarding these clips and who is speaking on them.  Defense Attorney re-states his objections to these being played to the jury.  Special Prosecutor Hahn presents further argument.  Further argument by defense.  The State will have the clips she wants to play transcribed  by Agent Van Schoyck and will email to Judge and Attorney Krische.  Nothing further for today.  This case with counsel present at 8:30.

Defendant appears in person with counsel Mathew Krische.  State appears by Special Prosecutor, Asst. Attorney General Amber Hahn.  Jury is not here yet at this time.  Discussion by counsel regarding priors for a witness, J.R.  Court orders the correct prior convictions for J.R. will be 17 for impeachment purposes.  Defense Counsel makes argument to the Court regarding the Motion to enter evidence of prior criminal convictions and to allow other testimony for 3 witnesses, J.R., S.B., and R.D..  State makes her argument to the Court.  Court finds all relevant testimony is admissable and does not find there may be unfair prejudice from the potential testimony.  Defense counsel may draft a jury instruction to address this.  Will allow the offer per the State on one but not the other.  Parties address a recorded telephone call that may be played with a 3rd voice that may not be identified by the State.  Amber Hahn brings to the Court's attention that the defendant spoke to a sequestered witness in the hall yesterday.  Defense counsel will talk to his client regarding this issue.  Court addresses the same issue with the gallery.

Motions held in chambers prior to jury trial commencing.  Motion to impeach witness J.R. and Plaintiff's Consciousness of Guilt brief discussed.  Court will decide those tomorrow.  Defense has no objection to Plaintiff's supplemental witness list.  Voir Dire discussion.  In Court:  Defendant appears with counsel Matthew Krische.  Special Prosecutor, Asst. Attorney General, Amber Hahn appears for the State.  Voir dire begins at 8:58.  Strikes are completed at 10:40 a.m.  Panel of 14 sworn by clerk.  Remaining jury panel members are excused.  Take short break.  Reconvene at 10:56 with opening instructions given.  Opening statements begin at 11:21.  State objects to a portion of defense's opening statement.  Jury is taken out.  State objects to defense referencing a witness, J.M., that has not been served to testify.  Attorney Krische states he wasn't aware this witness had not been served until now as the witness was on the State's witness list.  Judge rules he may continue with opening statement with no mention of the witness that won't be present.  In essence, objection was sustained.  Jury back in and Attorney Krische continues with his opening statement.  Opening statements conclude at 11:38.  Will break for lunch.  Court admonishes jurors to not discuss, research, etc. anything about this case.  Jury out and to reconvene by 1 pm.  

Back on record at  1:00 p.m..  State calls first witness, K.B., sworn, testifies.  Exhibit 1, Photo of deceased victim.  Defense cross-examines the witness.  No re-direct by the State and witness is released from subpoena.  State moves to admit Exhibit 1, received.  Next witness, K.W., sworn, and testifies.  Exhibit # 2 - Diagram of Apartment, witness testifies to exhibit.  Exhibit 2 moved, received and an enlargement of the same exhibit is published to the jury.  Exhibit 3 - Photo of Victim in Apartment, witness testifies to exhibit.  Exhibit is published to the jury electronically on the monitor.  Cross-examination by defense.  Witness reviews portions of her report to refresh memory.  Objection by the State as to when rigormortis sets in.  Overruled, will allow.  No re-direct and is released from subpoena.  State calls A.M., sworn, testifies.  Witness testifies to large Exhibit 2 and further questioning.  Exhibit #5 - Photocopy of victim's ID and debit card testifies to exhibit.  Record reflects ID of defendant by witness.  Cross-examination by defense.  Witness refreshes memory by looking a copy of his report.  Objection by the State - jury out.  Objection is overruled.  Jury back in with Attorney Krische continues questioning of witness.  Re-direct by the State.  Exhibit 4 - Contents of Victim's Pockets, witness testifies to exhibit.  State moves Exhibits 3, 4 & 5 into evidence, received.  Witness steps down but is not released from subpoena.  State calls T.C., sworn, testifies.  No cross-examination and is not released from subpoena at this time.  State calls A.N., sworn, testifies.  Witness ID's the defendant.  Exhibit 9 - Transmittal form of phones.  Exhibit 10 - Transmittal form & mail receipt for DNA evidence.  Exhibit 11 - Transmittal form for blood of victim.  State moves Exhibits 9, 10, 11/received.  Exhibit 8 - Co-op Credit Union Bank Statement of victim.  Exhibit 8 is moved into evidence/received.  Defense cross-examines witness.  No re-direct by the State and witness is released from subpoena.  Jury out.  Short conference by counsel with the Court while jury is still out.  State calls M.B., sworn, testifies.  States moves to find him a hostile witness and asks to impeach him.  Defense has no objection.  State has a video of the witness's interview with closed captioning.  Defense has seen the  clip and the transcript.  No objection to interview being played to jury.  Jury back in.  Court states victim was sworn outside the presence of the jury.  Witness testifies.  State moves to play video, Exhibit 6 with Transcript, Exhibit 7, of witness's recorded interview.  Permission granted to play video.  Defense cross-examines the witness.  Re-direct by the State.  Re-cross by defense.  Witness steps down and is not released from subpoena.  State calls K.G., sworn, testifies.  Witness testifies to Exhibit 8 and Exhibit 5.  Defense cross-examines witness.  Witness is released from subpoena.  State calls witness, K.C., by phone to testify, sworn and testifies.  Defense cross-examines the witness.  No re-direct and no further witnesses for today.  Jury to report by 10 a.m. and if they aren't able to get in they are to call the Clerk of Court's Office and possibly we may have a deputy pick them up.  Court admonishes the jurors to not discuss the case tonight.  State moves to admit Exhibits 6 & 7/both exhibits are received.
State's Bench Brief on Consciousness of Guilt Evidence
State's Supplemental Witness List
Motion to enter evidence of prior criminal convictions
State's Supplemental Witness List
Defendant's proposed verdict forms

Granting Leave to Amend Information
State's Proposed Jury Instructions and Verdict Forms

For Leave to Amend Information with attachment of Amended Information

Defendant appears in person with counsel Matthew Krische.  Special Prosecutor, AAG, Amber Hahn appears for the State.  Defense filed MIL with an impeachment motion to impeach Michael Bearfield with prior convictions.  State indicates she has reviewed the motion and the 2005 and 2006 convictions should not be used for impeachment.  Mr. Krische makes argument to include both convictions.  Court agrees they are too old but the other 6 prior convictions will be allowed.  May ask if he's ever been convicted of a crime and how many.  Both counsel will discuss the other witnesses that have convictions and will come to agreement.  State has no objection to the motion in limine by the State.  Defense has no objection to State's MIL either at this time.    Defense has filed proposed jury instructions and the State will file hers later today.  Both counsel will submit proposed verdicts as well.  

State has presented a Motion for Leave to Amend the Information this morning.  State explains her motion to the Court.  Defense objects to the Motion to add a Count 2 at this point and states his argument.  State responds to Attorney Krische's argument.  Court cites from the statute.  Court will take this under advisement and will make a written decision quickly.

State also addresses Item 7 in her Motion in Limine:  her witness is getting a doctor's written excuse as to why she needs to testify by phone.  Court grants that request as long as she gets the written excuse and it's provided to the defense.  The Court orders the doctor's note will be sealed once received.  

State discusses the possibility of one of her witnesses possibly not being compliant with his subpoena.  Just wanted to make the Court aware.

Transcript of motion/bond hearing held on 12/21/17
1.  Officer S.B. report from 6/10/15..

Special Prosecutor Amber Hahn appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Krische.   Defendant's Motion to introduce evidence of third party liability.  Legitimate tendency:  there must be a legitimate tendency that the third person could have committed the crime.   State referenced State vs. Wilson.  State not contesting the Denny motion.  State talks about the admissibility.  Defendant would have to testify if they bring this defense.  If not, that evidence should not be allowed.  Or State would move to amend the information to PTAC.  Court questioned the State regarding the companion case.  Jackson County case no. 15CF73.  Defense responded.  Defendant has the right to testify. Credibility is up to the jury.  Court responded to the defense argument.  Defense says opening arguments are not evidence.  

Bond motion.  Signature bond requested by the defense.  State responded.  State filed a report with the court.  Asking court to keep bond as previously ordered.  Defense responded.  Court ordered:  bond continued as previously ordered.   

Final pretrial will be the time to hear any further motions.

Defendant Dreama F Harvey in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Gerald Roger Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states they received one lab report back and did communicate an offer in January.  Defense states they do not have an agreement but believes the State is still waiting for one more lab result.  DA Fox states that is correct but that is the last thing they are waiting for.  Court states this case will be set for trial.  Will schedule for 3-day trial.  J.A. will schedule FPT and jury trial.  No motions to be heard on the day of the trial; will be heard at final pretrial.
Status conference on February 19, 2016 at 10:15.   Will be held in Jackson County.

Attorney Matthew Krische appeared by phone on behalf of his client.  Melissa S. Inlow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Goodman also by phone from Monroe County.  Attorney Krische states he just received an offer from the State yesterday and needs to review with his client yet.  State is also waiting for DNA results; drug results were received last week.  State also needs to get a copy of the recorded interviews to Mr. Krische.  Status conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 10:15 am.

No reporter and Judge Goodman and Attorney Matthew Krische appeared on behalf of defendant by phone.  ADA Melissa Inlow present in person.  ADA Inlow states they are waiting for results from crime lab on some evidence submitted.  Court set another TSC for 1-27-16 at 8:45.  This will be the last status.

Attorney Krische cross examination.  State redirect.  Attorney Krische re-cross.  State called Officer A.M., sworn by clerk.   Black River Falls Police Department.    2/14/15 on duty.  State questioned witness on incident and the officer's investigation.   Exhibit 1 marked.  Autopsy report.  State moved for admittance of exhibit 1.  No objection by defense for purposes of preliminary hearing.  Received by court.  Witness identified defendant.  Court reflects indentification for the purpose of this hearing.  Exhibit 2 marked.  Officer A.M.'s police report.  Attorney Krische cross examination.  No other witnesses.  State moves for bind over.  Attorney Krische argued against bind over.  Court found probable cause.
